block.p: Lela Miller Moore, a daughter of Jean G. Moore and Hugh J. Moore Jr. of Chattanooga, Tenn., and Steven Ryan, a son of Eileen M. Valinoti and Steven J. Valinoti, both of Levittown, N.Y., were married yesterday evening. Thomas Ryan, the bridegroom's uncle and a Universal Life minister, officiated at the Hudson Theater in Manhattan.

The bride, 30, will keep her name. She is a news assistant at The New York Times. She graduated cum laude from Middlebury College and received a master's in journalism from New York University. Her father is a lawyer at Chambliss, Bahner & Stophel, a law firm in Chattanooga. Her mother is a volunteer reading teacher at Woodmore Elementary School there.
The couple were married Saturday evening at the Hudson Theater in Manhattan.

Lela Miller Moore, a daughter of Jean G. Moore and Hugh J. Moore Jr. of Chattanooga, Tenn., and Steven Ryan, a son of Eileen M. Valinoti and Steven J. Valinoti, both of Levittown, N.Y., were married yesterday evening. Thomas Ryan, the bridegroom's uncle and a Universal Life minister, officiated at the Hudson Theater in Manhattan.

The bride, 30, will keep her name. She is a news assistant at The New York Times. She graduated cum laude from Middlebury College and received a master's in journalism from New York University. Her father is a lawyer at Chambliss, Bahner & Stophel, a law firm in Chattanooga. Her mother is a volunteer reading teacher at Woodmore Elementary School there.

The bridegroom, 29, is the assistant producer of ''Talking Movies,'' a weekly television show on BBC World, and he is also a puppeteer at the Czechoslovak-American Marionette Theater company in Manhattan. His father is an auto-damage field supervisor in Brooklyn at Geico, the car insurance company.
